3.5.20  6:56 pm   What is music

      a highly customizable feels enhancer. if you present a lemon, coupled with exactly the right tailor made music, the feels of the lemon can go to upwards of 50,000,000 times their original base feel. is it the music we're feeling? technically yes, but the feelings are being anchored into a tangible mental space: the lemon. the music is enhancing and shaping the feels of the lemon. with no lemon, the music will not know which feels to enhance

3.5.20  4:52 pm   Does your keyboard have a shift key?

     yes, it actually has 2. actually i have 8 keyboards with shift keys, each one has 2 shift keys so that's 16 shift keys. however, 14 of those don't behave as shift keys, they are reserved for other functions

3.5.20  4:17 pm   I'm trying very hard to master my first solo album. It's very hard. Should I give up?

     no. i've heard some first solo albums that are mastered very strangely. also seen some pilots of tv shows that have very bad color. this is just when you learn stuff. so go ahead and finish it up and learn what you'll learn from it. you'll be more learnt up for next time

     why do people consider the opinions of people who don't respect them when acting then become surprised when others don't do the same?

why didn't my last question make only partial sense?

     it did, i was able to make partial sense out of it

     will you be able to answer all of these?

     i'll see what i can do

     the idea will choose when you think it. so in that way it's almost like the idea is thinking of you

3.5.20  1:43 pm   Are there things that you know that you don't know?

     yes

      Or what about things you don't know if you know?

     yes

3.5.20  1:40 pm   What is the greatest secret that you have never told anybody?

     it's beginning to look a lot like christmas

3.5.20  1:23 pm   If you close your eyes and hit a random key on your keyboard, could you tell what note it is?

     sure

      And how useful is it?

     well,

      Would you recommend learning it?

     if you have recently heard or played any other notes which you know what they are, then, ANY other note that is played, you MUST know what it is. if you can't get that then you need to get that. However, if you have not recently heard any sound or notes or music which you know the actual notes of, like for example if you just woke up in the morning and have no memory of any songs or notes that you can identify, then it is not expected that you be able to blindly identify the next note. having that skill would be called absolute pitch, and it's kind of like when you can identify a note in a completely and absolutely musicless way, with no musical relation to anything. this is a strange skill that is not related to music in any way whatsoever. To get back to your original question, yes i would be able to identify the note, because i can always remember the last note i heard, and i knew what that one was, so therefore i will know what the next one is when i hear it. also when doing this on a physical keyboard it is made even easier by the fact that the keyboard is shaped in such a way that you can eliminate about half of the notes just based on shape of the key physically

3.5.20  1:19 pm   How do you answer questions correctly?

     impossible. it can't be done

3.5.20  1:19 pm   thoughts on icebergs?

     nicebergs, that's what i call them

3.5.20  12:57 pm   hey, so it seems like the only instruments that remain consistent throughout an entire arrangement of yours is like bass and drums. that would make sense to like explain  the fills you do to express the harmony and stuff. i mean there are outliers, the harpsichord on outside. the strings in school. but is this true, more or less? 

     that might be because when different instruments play the role of the bass, they are all usually called the bass. when different instruments play the role of the drums/percussion, they are always called drums/percussion. however, when many different instruments play the role of the middle/chord/melody range, people like to call those instruments by different names. so mostly i think it's a naming situation you are noticing

3.5.20  12:55 pm   what am I supposed to do with my left hand when playing piano? I know some options are "play a deep bass note" or "play a bassline" but I'm more interested in what people are doing when they have both hands in the middleish range of the keyboard and are playing more than one note in the left hand. Is that just a means of playing wide chords?

     i doubt it. there's hardly even room for 2 hands in the real chordal zone of the keyboard. if someone else is playing the bass, AND someone else is playing the melody, then what i usually do is tie my left hand behind my back. if you are supposed to play the melody and chords both on the instrument, then you're gonna have to put chords in left hand and melody in right hand and to be honest i don't have a lot of experience doing that. if you have chords and no bass player, and you are singing the melody, then i think you definitely are going to want to take care of the bass in the left hand and chords with the right. so as you can see, the piano is like a banquet table. it is used in all different ways depending on how many and who the guests are and make sure you don't put 2 whole turkeys in the exact same spot

3.5.20  12:51 pm   I wanted to try and name/internalize my favorite chord voicings so that I can become good at using them on the spot when I'm following a melody. My method right now is a combination of guessing/muscle memory and I hate it. Of course that doesn't work at all for improvisation since it's basically random. So is the naming/internalizing thing a good idea? Or am I completely lost?

     you could do some of that. you could also learn some songs. and also improvise a lot. all those things should eventually merge into one if you play your cards right

3.5.20  12:34 pm   A while a go you said each question makes you stronger. How strong are you now?

     i think i am almost ready to cure weakness

3.5.20  12:29 pm   How to win at acronyms

     you must find those reasonable phrases. scan the whole word from beginning to end and look for opportunities to put in the most normal phrases you can think of. acronyms are most impressive when they don't sound like acronyms. in other words don't fill the whole damn thing with animals doing useless activities

3.5.20  11:52 am   3.4.20  2:16 pm this is immediately my new favorite answer you've given of all time. Not even my question, just a really good answer. Touched my soul. Do you have a theory why this song is so dang good? *GrAcIaS*

     got to be the mario cameo in one of the verse breaks

3.5.20  11:33 am   I really want to create something but I just don't know what,like maybe my own game, or a song, possibly compose cool music, or maybe a company but I just don't know where to start if I were to do a project in general. I feel like I should be doing something great in life, what do I do? 

     start somewhere extremely simple. either write, type, or draw on a blank page. just see what happens. use it to ask what you want to do and where you want to go. the blank page never lies, it just gets you to say true stuff, because you never lie either

3.5.20  11:00 am   When could you listen/look at someone say this person has potential to start making music?

     that's kind of a catch 22. anything that is really a sure sign that someone has music in them, could most likely be considered music which means they've already started making music. For example, if someone takes a few steps with their shoes on the ground in a sort of musical way, .... and you may be thinking 'hm, that person should start making music'. well, it's too late they already started

     it probably happens most when doing non-song videos
